result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LaRoyce A. Hudson

defendant.name: Hudson, LaRoyce A.
defendant.address: W8866 Decorah Rd, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt:
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Andrew King Kimble.
Bond covers both cases 21CF162 & 22CF40.
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

12:49 PM Defendant LaRoyce A. Hudson appeared by video, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney April Lande appeared by video for LaRoyce A. Hudson.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense requests low cash bond or signature bond. State requests $250. cash bond w/previous same conditions. $250.00 cash bond ordered w/previous same conditions. Bond covers both cases. Set a STC 11/7 @ 3 pm.

BAIL/BOND HEARING 10.25.2022 @ 1 PM
